newsitem.title: USA: Children's Wonderland president, CFO quits.
newsitem.headline: Children's Wonderland president, CFO quits.

text.p: Children's Wonderland Inc said on Monday that its president and chief financial officer, Michael Laney, resigned.
The company also said it is exploring a number of strategic alternatives to cut overhead and costs and to streamline its operations while focusing on its most profitable programs.
Debby Bitticks, the Children's chief executive, will take over the duties of president, while William Popok, the controller, will be acting chief financial officer, the company said.
"We brought Michael to help manage our expansion, and we are sorry to see him go," Chairman Kenneth Bitticks said in a statement.
Laney, in a statement released by the company, said, "I fully respect Children's Wonderland's mission and wish the company future success."
Children's Wonderland provides for dependent-care needs of working families through its educational, counseling and health care services.
